# Complex n-th roots of unity

More information forthcoming. Here are the complex 14-th roots of unity. These are the 14 solutions to the equation $x^{14} - 1 = 0$. There are only 2 real solutions $1$ and $-1$.

```{r,fig.width=4.5,fig.height=4.5}
n = 14
ii = 0+1i
w = exp(2*pi*ii/n)
G = w^(0:(n-1))
G
plot(Re(G),Im(G),col='red',pch=19,xlim=c(-2,2),ylim=c(-2,2))
grid()
```
```{r,fig.width=4.5,fig.height=4.5}
n = 17
ii = 0+1i
w = 1.02*exp(2*pi*ii/n)
G = w^(-50:100)
plot(Re(G),Im(G),col='gray',xlim=c(-2,2),ylim=c(-2,2),type='l')
grid()
tt = seq(0,2*pi,length=1000)

points(Re(G),Im(G),col='orange',pch=19)
points(Re(w),Im(w),pch=19,col='blue')
```
